Reviews.Title: “Dated & small but excellent staff, clean and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Neptune75
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel by any stretch but we chose the hotel for its amazing location being central to the Bell Center, restaurants, nightlife and down town. The front office staff were excellent and got us into our room quite early (0900 check-in). The rooms were clean although our room was extremely small. As we were traveling with family we were able to see another of the queen room which was considerably bigger than ours and I'm sure would comfortably accommodate a couple. Simon (our self confessed "super sexe" bartender) was excellent and managed the after hockey beer fueled crowd extremely well. He was quick with a laugh & a beer and made us feel very welcomed to Montreal and the hotel. The Cora's restaurant and foyer gift shop were both convenient when we needed a quick breakfast or souvenirs. The hotel is apparently under refurbishment and whilst we obviously had an older room we didn't notice any noise from the work. The only gripe would be the lack of house keeping as we didn't have our room attended to in two days. All in all the hotel was exactly what we expected and wanted - simple, clean and unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewBradlex
Reviews.Content: Super CLEAN!!!! It was first what we with my wife noticed when entered the room. New renovation for sure done it's job. Not small, but very cosy rooms with LCD HDTV, comfortable bed, and clean but small bathroom(but you shouldn't take care to much about size of bathroom when you are on weekend in downtown of Montreal) Parking just cross the street, so it was easy to access my car. Overal hotel is very decent and well kept! Defenetly will stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Christine A
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in the spring. The room we were in appeared newly remodeled, and was very clean. Small, but more than adequate for a weekend getaway to Montreal. Very close to many great restaurants and attractions downtown. The lobby was under construction, but this did not affect us at all. The only problem I had was that the wifi signal in our room was fairly poor. Would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room not great staff at reception.”
Reviews.Author: poupoun
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a night here and was not very impressed.. It is a great location but the service at chek in and out... was not great The person who served me was not very pleasant at all..No thanks for staying How was it?? Nothing.. I am used to staying at the Holiday Inn in Chinatown and they are amazing at reception.. Anyway the person who wrote the review about the small Queen room and should update to a KINg DOnt bother.. Our room was a KIng and you could hardly walk betweent he bed and the dresser. Saw the Queen and not much smaller.. No problem as we are there to sleep.. This hotel is still under construction and smells of paint.., They should tell you this.. Also there is NO business centre and no computer acces if you dont have a laptop.. Should be posted a least WOuld have brought the laptop..ld have liked to know about renos up front... or at least get a discount fo smell of paint and no internet... Email if you have any questions.. To the hotel.. Get better people at reception or we will not be back..Want his anme email me.. I will go back to the HOliday Inn in a flash Too. Bad I like the points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago on business and I have to admit, I am impressed with the new room decor. The hotel is in a great location whether you downtown for business meetings, looking for some night life and specially if you are looking for a place close to the Bell Centre. I would deffinately return. I can't wait to see what the lobby will be like once the renos are finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For A Habs Game!”
Reviews.Author: luci_v
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend and I stayed at this Best Western for 2 nights to go to a Canadiens game. Check in was very quick and the lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The hotel does not have parking, but you can park in the lot across the street for $20 per night with in and out privileges. Like other reviews stated the Queen size room is small, but we didn't spend much time in the room so this was not an issue for us! A bigger concern for us is whether the room and bathroom is clean and again we had no issues. The room was spotless and the bed was super comfortable. If you are going for a hockey game, you can not beat the location and price!! The hotel is less then 2 blocks from the Bell Centre. If you are going for shopping; Rue St. Catherines is just as close. We loved our stay and plan on staying here again! Also, there is a fire station on the same street, but we DID NOT hear sirens all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the heart of Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: paul k
Reviews.Content: Lucked out on selecting a reasonably priced hotel in the heart of downtown Montreal....conveniently located 2 blocks from the Bell Center, short walk (3 blocks) to train station, 100 meters from St. Catherine St.and 1 klm from the old city district. Combined business with a bit of pleasure with friends by taking in a Canadiens hockey game, shopping and touring beautiful Montreal.The hotel rooms were super clean, and large with a very comfortable bed. Loved the hardwood floors in our rooms....a nice change from the typical carpeting. Hotel is undergoing front lobby renovations which will spruce things up at the entrance. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...construction is annoying though, but wasn't terrible.”
Reviews.Author: dizzygoo82
Reviews.Content: The location is great...only a couple blocks from the bell centre and one block from st Catherine's st. The rooms are small but not so small where you can't move. I had breakfast at Cora's and it was yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Thinking Best Western would be predictably good”
Reviews.Author: mcsoliver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely under construction-I would check with hotel to see when this will be finished. The room was very clean to start, but not thoroughly cleaned for the following night. The view was a wall about 2 feet away so no natural light. The gym had no towels or water in water cooler and I am not sure when they last cleaned the equipment. The location is very convenient! The beds were very comfortable. Staff was very nice. There is no spa. Cora's restaurant serves a very yummy selection of breakfast. Will choose another hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “Not for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Explorer_Geo
Reviews.Content: I don't want to sound too critical but this hotel despite quite a solid price does not even meet a normal 3* hotel standard. Only good thing is the location. Otherwise, entrance to the hotel building was not cleaned from dirty melt down snow, there was nobody to help with the luggage, interior corridors on the floors reminded some kind of a cheap dormitory, and the last thing - breakfast which was paid and included in my bill was literally a single plate consisting of a bagel. On top of all this, in the smallest hotel room I've ever had there was a huge heater with such a terrible noise that it was almost impossible to sleep. All in all, I would not stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: frugalkarsha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my husband to attend a hockey game and to see the sights of montreal. It was a short walk to the Bell Centre and very close to St. Caterines and underground shopping. Rooms were small but VERY clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Cora's breakfast was in the hotel and was great! Will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Sam P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with a friend this past weekend (first time in montreal) Pro's - GREEEEAT! location, friendly staff (cutest little housekeeper), VERY! clean room and bathrooms, (just gotta say it again) amaaaazing location.. literally thirty seconds away from st. catherines street (montreals main downtown area, reallly close to the clubbing scene which was the main reason for our trip and super close to eaton centre), no disturbance from neighbours or anything, surprisingly cute modern room, everything close by (bought metro passes and didn't use it at all, although really close to the metro station cons- cold room although i'm sure if we would have asked, the friendly staff would have taken care of it right away. but my friend and i didn't care soo.. wasn't a big deal to us. queen bed is just enough space for two people (we were two girls, both 20/21) ALTHOUGH we did leave our close and property everywhere! and wasn't crammed. all in all, we def enjoyed our stay and trip.. we will stay here again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Worest vacation at Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Nini W
Reviews.Content: We were here at Best Western Europa, Montreal. The hotel doesn't have a parking. So we're advised to park infront of the hotel in a private parking, which gives a discount to the hotel customers. We made the parking payment at the the hotel reception. When we came back from the hotel, the parking attendant insulted us for absolutely no reason claiming he hasn't recieve money from us, despite we showed him the reciept. He didn't stop there, he also pushed one of the guys and threaten two of us. Then he kicked the bumper and broke it. Surprisingle, when we report this to the hotel stuff, all they said was it is a private parking so they don't know basically it's your problem not the hotel. Although we were referred to the pariking lot by the hotel stuff and we make the parking payment at the hotel, the stuffs claimed that the hotel got nothing to do with anything. They simply said call police and report. We wanted to spend a nice holiday with family but unfortunatelly picked the wrong hotel!! Worest place to stay especially in winter. Don't recommend at all. At least the staffs should be supportive as they were when they take the parking payment but instead they seemed strange!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Spa!!”
Reviews.Author: emily l
Reviews.Content: Dirty, dusty, tacky decor, not at all like other hotel spas I've been to. The shower heads were old, encrusted with calcium and didn't work properly. Shower curtains on the other hand should be burnt or at the very least washed. The "outdoor terrance" was not accessable during my visit. the lounge area looked like a cheap cafeteria. The massage was not a full body massage like they are chargeing for and I've had better facials. Lastly, I would not describe the staff as friendly or professional. I was not asked if i had problem areas, what kind of massage i wanted or if the pressure during my massage was good. This spa is chargeing atleast twice what they are really worth

Reviews.Title: “Affordable choice for Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: rhtrips333
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Europa is in a great location in Downtown Montreal, you can walk to everything. The lobby is downstairs when you walk in the hotel, which is a bit odd, but it is nice. The bar/lounge is usually empty but it did have great, affordable sandwiches since we needed to eat late at night coming off of Amtrak. The lobby and bar is the nicest part of the hotel, the floors with the rooms are outdated and in need of an update. The rooms are outdated too, but they are clean. The breakfast restaurant in the hotel lobby is not connected to the hotel, which is a bit odd too. As a strange side note - be careful walking down the block the hotel is on, the fire station is right there and a firetruck almost ran us over coming out of the station - there are no markings at all that it is there. The hotel was very in expensive, so I feel that I cannot complain, because for the money, it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GreatLakesroadster
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here for three years as BW members and always enjoy. Although like many mid level city centre hotels it does not have pool and workout room, neither are really needed although a jacuzzi would be nice after hours walking the city! close to all shops, restos and the fine arts museum is just around the corner. Clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: NickyInBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel is right in the heart of the downtown area, so you have access to everything - if you enjoy shopping, you can't go wrong, it's all there for you. And it's only a couple of blocks from the nearest subway station (Peel) too, so not very far to go for getting to anywhere else in the Montreal region. It's also within walking distance of Parc Royal du Montreal (maybe 20 minutes to the base of the hill) - uphill, just to clarify though. Plus you have a real uphill climb to then get to the top! So if you're not one for anything more than a gentle stroll, you might be better advised to drive it. The hotel itself was more than what I'd hoped for. Although an old building, the inside seems nicely renovated. My room was small, but extremely comfortable, clean and modern, with wooden floors. The bathroom was small but modern, and there wasn't much space between the toilet and the bath, or much space to even turn around in. This was all perfectly fine for me, but it's something to consider if you're either someone who wants a lot of space in general in hotels, or even if you're a physically large person. I really enjoyed my stay though, and would definitely return when I'm back in Montreal. I can absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly worth the money”
Reviews.Author: xiongxiong43
Reviews.Content: My room was small, but it got everything especially the free fast wifi. The staff was nice and the hotel is very conveniently located. I got a rate of (Can$)99/night with my AAA membership card. It's a great deal. One shortcoming is the heater/aircon that was too loud and too warm if left on all night. However, one night I turned off the heater and I woke up cold since my bed was next to the window. I should have asked for more blankets instead. The restaurant (chez Cora) could be slow in the morning depending what time you go there. The food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently reliable. I will return.”
Reviews.Author: Can_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times - most recently in October 2011. It offers a great combination of good price, good location, clean and comfortable rooms, and friendly efficient service. You might find the proximity to Rue St. CathÃ©rine a plus or a minus. I enjoy the activity at all times of day (and I've always had quiet rooms in this hotel, so there has never been overspill of the atmosphere when I've been trying to sleep). The shopping area is certainly very close and convenient, but elderly or more traditionally-minded travellers may find the Rue St. CathÃ©rine night-life a little brash, so you may not enjoy an evening walk in the direct vicinity of the hotel. The free wifi is strong enough to hold a good conversation via Skype video. The hotel doesn't seem to operate its own restaurant (despite signs in the building) but there's a Cora breakfast/lunch restaurant just off the lobby, which is very good. The queue to enter Cora can be long!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you like to shop!”
Reviews.Author: drdavid5
Reviews.Content: Our Stay was Thurs. Nov.24-Sat Nov 25th. We were greeted at the front desk by a huge smile . She was very fun but also professional. Unfortunatly I can not recall her name. The room was 527. This room is small like a Microtel hotel room. We had a king bed & hardwood floor. The room was in great shape , updated & clean.Yes the bathroom is a little small but we really liked the room. As for the bar in the hotel I must say its a little bizarre in that they only take cash . No room charge and no credit cards, just cash! The Bartender Marley was nice but they use that premeasure gun system so the drinks were just o.k.. Location is great if you want to shop on Saint Catherine St. or the underground mall. Make a left out of the main entrance and its just a short 1/2 block walk to St.Cathirine St. (1-2 minute walk at most). We ate at the Italian restaurant next door and the pizza was very good. Parking is directly across the street and they charge $20.00 per day. Overall we enjoyed our stay and I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accommodations in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: vaquero viajero
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Europa for three nights for a conference. I had stayed there before several years ago. The hotel is centrally located near the main shopping district downtown but a bit of a hike to the Old City. The room was small but comfortable and reasonably priced, perhaps a bit overpriced at rack rate but who pays rack rate? The staff were very helpful and friendly and obviously fully fluent in English and French. The room was small but comfortable. Like many mid-range hotels these days it was a little tired but with nice furnishings, linens and a comfortable bed. My room with street side but I had no problems with noise. Parking was across the street and is not run by the hotel. It was a bit of a problem because the attendant told me that a day's parking is not 24 hours but any portion of a day. I find this to be a rip off. I will be back to the hotel and perhaps explore other parking options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Canuck123
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Grand Prix weekend - June 2011. Rooms are small but you only go there to sleep. Metro just a short walk away. Cora's restaurant serves a great breakfast. Staff was friendly and accommodating. If you are looking for a no-fuss stay, book it. If you are looking for amenities right in the hotel, not for you. Everything is centrally located - shops, food outlets and more. Very safe at night too.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, no thrills”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: Not a bad choice if you get hold of a discounted rate, but at their standard rates there is probably better value for money in town. Rooms are OK but basic. Location is close to Rue St CathÃ©rine so good for shopping, but the area gets rather seedy at night. Free internet PC's are available.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 2 night stay.. Would definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: stugats10
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 rooms for 2 nights. First off the woman who worked the front desk Sat Nov 5th was very helpful and patient. I had confusing reservations (using miles for a room, Best western points for another and then regular reservation for another). She worked with me to satisfy my needs.. Even got the the rooms across the hall from each other..Liked he hard wood floors in room. Comfortable bed, good TV service and a spacious restroom. Only complaint I had was the internet service in room. IT was slow and sporadic.. Btu otherwise I really enjoyed the stay and service.. Breakfast restaurant in lobby was real good as well.. Location was excellent also.. Parking was 20 per day at lot right across the street. Easy in and out any time we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: Nuts4TravelSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in September. When I arrived, I had to wait awhile to check in as several large parties were being served and there were only two desk clerks. The location is right off the major shopping street and an easy walk from the train station. It is situated near several parking lots which were noisy at night and early in the morning and gave an appearance to the neighborhood as being a bit run down. I heard several car alarms throughout the night and morning. The room was small; barely any room between the desk and the bed. The bathroom was particularly tight. I did really liked the hardwood floors. I am not sure why this is a "Plus" hotel. There was nothing really "Plus" about it.

Reviews.Title: “5 Great days in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Wheezela
Reviews.Content: I visited Montreal last week for a conference. It is a splendid city with a great clean and fresh feel to the downtown area, fantastic shopping and vibe on St Catherine Street and a very charming Old Town. The city I highly recommend! The conference was at the Hilton Bonaventure, unfortunately I was unable to get a room there and was shopping around for some time trying to find something that matched my budget and which was not too far from the conference venue. I eventually settled for the Best Western Downtown and it was an excellent choice! It is a very reasonably priced hotel in a perfect location, just off St Catherine's Street, 15-20 minutes pleasant walking distance from the Old Town and within the center of Downtown. The room was comfortable with good white linen, the bathroom also clean and very functional. The room may have been a little on the small side (queen) for 2 people for too long, but if you're not planning on spending your time in your room its fine. Yes, there are a few little cracks and peeling paint here and there but I don't think that draws away from the comfort or functionality of the room at all. There was also excellent wifi connection in the room which was very important for me. Sometimes I found the fans in the areas surrounding my room a little loud, and there was some noise from outside on some nights, but this is to be expected when you're in such a central location. The front desk was pleasant and helpful although I did not need too much assistance from them. All in all I had a very pleasant and memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1770
Reviews.Content: Four Night Stay â€“ September 6-9, 2011. We found location to be perfect for sightseeing, subway, shopping, etc. At check-in â€“ Benoit â€“ was most helpful and very pleasant. He suggested parking options and guided us on the city sites for this first time Montreal visitor. We had Room 304 (recently remodeled?) which was at the back of hotel â€“ not much view but very quiet â€“ large room with 2 large double beds â€“ very comfortable padded mattress and multiple pillow types. Desk â€“ Table area separated from sleeping area. Flat Screen TV â€“ clear reception. Bathroom was small but workable. Excellent housekeeping â€“ I was very impressed on how clean room was each day. Upon return to room each evening it was like we first walked in unlike some other hotels where the cleaning staff is not as detailed when you are a multiple night resident. Parking is off premises but we knew this. We parked at recommended secure enclosed structure on Rue Stanley. Was fine â€“ $20 a day. Formal onsite restaurant closed down â€“ that would be a nice future addition. Enjoyed our stay and would made reservations at this hotel, in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Tired”
Reviews.Author: peter_sue20
Reviews.Content: This is not one of Best Westerns better properties. It is rather tired although the room that we were assigned looked as though it had been recently up dated. The bar fridge had however been removed leaving a bit of a void. The bath room was very small. The location is very convenient for down town,shopping,restaurants etc. It is not however very convenient to the old quarter and walking back at night could be a problem. Overall the hotel is a little over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: readytotravel11
Reviews.Content: Rooms were slightly small (nothing like QuÃ©bec City) but well decorated, modern and very comfortable. I loved that it was non-smoking and there was no evidence of any odor of smoke, which is hard to find in downtown MontrÃ©al. Very conveniently located; walking distance to everything from fancy dinners, fast food, shopping, pharmacies and entertainement. The lobby is attached to the best breakfast place ever (Cora's). Parking, although not included in the price of the stay, was very reasonably priced, safe and allows in and out priviliges. We were very happy with our stay and would most certainly stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “great location,reasonably priced,”
Reviews.Author: cint044
Reviews.Content: lacks cleanliness, toilet tends to runs. We stayed for three days , the mirror in the bathroom was dirty upon arrival and was never cleaned for the rest of the stay. Bathroom somewhat neglected . Pop machines never worked, smoke detector hanging from the ceiling in a cage. although the room was small and somewhat old, it was nicely decorated and if you can over look the lack of cleaniless in the bathroom it is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but ....”
Reviews.Author: hsuumon
Reviews.Content: It definitely was in a great location. We could walk to everywhere. On the first day, we walked to Notre-Dame and the old Montreal. Later, we found a Pixi Station was just at the corner of Drummond and St. Catherine O. so we used Pixi to everywhere after wards. Very convenient! On the other hand, the walls at the hotel are extremely thin. We can hear everyone's conversation loud and clear from the hallway or from the room. Unfortunately for us, there was a large group of high school/college kids partying on the floor the entire night and we could not sleep. The hotel would have been fine if it wasn't for those super thin wall. The elevators are too small and slow. If you are trying to call an elevator during rush hours, plan to wait a few mins. Also, the parking wasn't included and the parking lot across the street has no affiliation with the hotel and they charge $20 from noon to noon, regardless of what time you get in.

Reviews.Title: “great location, thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Travel21
Reviews.Content: I stayed last weekend for 4 nights with my sister and brother-in-law, the parking that is available across the street is not included which is no big deal, but when you need to pay $80 up front for in and out privileges. Thatâ€™s a bit much. When getting to the hotel the staff was ok not impressed, I work at a hotel in Toronto, and know when people like customer service and when they donâ€™t! When we asked about the parking the girl told us it was not included but however they offered a discount for parking about $18 a day, but no in and out privileges. No breakfast included either, so the room was no big deal either to double beds, comfy I will say, bath was basic, but the A/C unit in the room wake us all up during the night because when it started up it sounded like a bomb going off and again the same thing when I turned off, oh and one morning housekeeping knocked on the door and as we anwsered yes, she was already opening the door, then noticed and closed it and walked away, no sorry or anything. Over all I wouldnâ€™t stay there again nor would I encourage anyone I know to either, but that was my personal experience, I did really like the bar/ lounge they have with the pool table and the bartender that serviced us was the only person who should any hospitality to us, she should be recognized.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest queen room ever!”
Reviews.Author: Joyyy
Reviews.Content: Our queen bed hotel room was way too small for 2 adults. There was very little room to walk between the bed and the tv stand. The bathroom was even smaller. When sitting on the toilet, our knees hit the side of the bathtub. Could hardly turn around. One day our room was not made up at 4 p.m. when we returned early after being wet from torrential rains. Had to beg for service. Parking cost $15/night and it was a public lot across the street. If you want in/out privileges it costs $20/or more a night. The restaurant on the main floor closes at 3 p.m. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: thebeaus
Reviews.Content: If your planning a trip to dowtown Montreal, this is a great hotel, just minutes away from the Bell Center and all the dowtown shops. It is very clean, staff was very courtious. The rooms are newly renovated, not very spacious but if your looking for comfort for a fair price, this hotel is what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.... Tiny rooms and worn down interior.”
Reviews.Author: PeggerinVan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was likely lovely 30 years ago, but it is in desperate need of renovations. Everything was faded and the paint in our room was chipped. The rooms were the most disappointing of all...so tiny we could barely navigate ourselves around the bed. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great area and is literally just steps from St Catherine's St. Next time, think we'll splurge and try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never come back here again”
Reviews.Author: Dewael
Reviews.Content: Being a platinum member they have put us in the smallest noisyest room ever. We have stayed in a lot of best westerns but this is realy the most Awfull one.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the spa”
Reviews.Author: 3leafclover
Reviews.Content: Hotel is average, nuff said. There is no nice way to put this: the spa is awful. Scheduled a couples massage and was horrified. I am willing to bet the therapist I had was not a certified massage therapist. She did not provide me with a receipt afterwards for my insurance, she asked the other therapist to do it for her. The massage was down right uncomfortable. It actually wasn't a massage is was simply rubbing and something I can only describe as petting. My boyfriend said his therapist was slightly better. If this was run as a proper spa, I bet this would be a great location. The rooftop terrace has potential if given a little TLC. Sadley the sauna is lukewarm and the shower in the women's changing room does not work. Not worth the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown, Bed, Working Toilet, Cheap... Works for me!”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: It's located just off Ste-Catherine, which was key to me picking this one, plus the rate was a absolute steal! There's a public outdoor parking lot next door (it was $20/night when I was there). I showed up at around 4pm and was able to check right in, nice & easy. The lobby is very impressive for a "budget hotel" (unfortunately I didn't snap a pic of it). The staff was pleasant. The room was small as far as rooms go, but I was the only one staying there so that wasn't a problem. It was clean and being someone that looks more for value over luxury, as long as everything works I'm a happy camper. Sure enough everything that I needed worked. Pretty decent complimentary WiFi signal as well. I would definitely recommend it for a guys weekend / hockey game trip, couples looking for a no frills getaway (very simple, not romantic), or a single person on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “We will never come back”
Reviews.Author: crtripad
Reviews.Content: Our room (2 large beds) has been recently refurbished however the water would not evacuate from the bath. The toilet seat behind the lid was covered by urinal marks and long black hairs (none of us has long, black hairs) => see picture, obviously the cleaning is not well done The room had only one small window opening against a wall side (2feet clearance) => the room is permanently dark. The air conditionning unit (very old) is making a terrible noize. I was told at the hotel that the parking lot across the main entrance of the hotel was charged 20$ per 24hours. I arrived at 7:00pm and took my car the next day at 2:00pm, ... and got charged a second time because the 20$ was valid only till 12:00 am ... Regarding the breakfast, the queue to get placed in the restaurant was getting all the way to the lobby => at least 20mn waiting time

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location; great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Delish71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok; we got to use our Air Miles which means our room wasn't the fanciest. Actually, the room only had one sliver of a window looking into a dark courtyard. Fortunately, we were in Montreal for the shopping and restaurants and didn't care about our hotel. So it was a good deal for us! There is a Cora's on the main level where you can go for breakfast - delish!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - small but lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: BandDW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel July 24th to 28th and had a wonderful stay. The rooms are small by most standards, but all rooms have hard wood floors which are a great touch as carpeting is usually nasty in most hotels. The bathrooms are also small, but very functional with great water pressure for showers. The people at reception were very friendly and helpful and the location is just perfect since it is steps away from Ste. Catherine Street and very close to all major shopping areas. There is a Cora's restaurant on the premises for breakfast and lunch which serves great food and there is a small bar open from 5:00 p.m. There is no place for dinner in the hotel, but there are more than enough restaurants around the area. I would absolutely stay here again. It is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Sleep”
Reviews.Author: marilynfriedman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located, but old, small rooms, and noisy air conditioner, with no ability to open window. No fan available and no ventilation--unless you turned on air conditioner which made it impossible to sleep. Would not recommend unless you bring ear plugs and are fantastic sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for the price”
Reviews.Author: RhoDylandAnne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a reunion of friends made on a Danube cruise two years ago. We booked two rooms with king-size beds, one with two queen-sized beds and one single. Single-bedded rooms were small-ish but two-bed room was quite large. Refrigerator came with the room. Beds were very comfortable Decor appeared to be recently updated. There was a "new wood" smell to the rooms. We shopped prices and locations for a long time before settling on this choice, and allof us were very satisfied. While breakfast is not free, the adjoining Chez Cora offers a wonderfully fresh and reasonably priced breakfast (and lunch.) Many excellent restaurants close by. Many famous sites within reasonable walking distance. Staff was friendly although stressed, as it was an extremely busy time for the entire city. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but the staff need to learn customer service..”
Reviews.Author: travel6809
Reviews.Content: - The location of this hotel is excellent. - The staff at this hotel need to go through customer service 101...we came back at 10 to four and found the room was not made...I had a shower then we received a knock at the door asking to make up the room we asked if she could come back in five minutes...she said that if she did not do it know she would not be able to make up the room as she had to leave at 4...there are better ways to talk to a customer - parking costs $20 a night and it mounts up..

Reviews.Title: “Cramped room, but otherwise pretty good”
Reviews.Author: nickboldt
Reviews.Content: Room was cramped, but that's partly because we had a week's worth of stuff with us, including two bikes. Parking is avail in exposed lots just down the street or across the street, or in a walkup garage just south. Either way, we felt better unloading the car so ended up with minimal space in the room. Bathroom was so small we had to sit sideways to use the toilet. Reminded me of hotels I've stayed at in Germany and Czech... but smaller. Beyond that, pretty standard experience from a hotel. Cora restaurant on ground floor was great for brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located”
Reviews.Author: jpmcba
Reviews.Content: Friendly front desk staff. Hotel does not have rooms with 2 queen size beds, but their room with 2 double size beds is big! - you can request for a rollaway for 25$. Room and bathroom were very clean, and had all the right amenities. The only disappointment was that although our reservation was for a non-smoking room, our room had a strong smell of cigarette smoke. Just up the block is Rue Sainte-Catherine which is blocks and blocks of stores - including name brands - and fabulous malls. Many restaurants in the area. Notre Dame cathedral is a 30-minute walk, and many restaurants in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Good Price, Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: erad73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October 2010. The location is great--right in the heart of the city, St. Catherine's Street is on one side and the Bell Centre on the other. If you're a single person or a couple, this hotel is cheap and offers the city at your step. I would not recommend it for families or anyone who wants to hang out in the hotel as the rooms are small and the neighborhood a bit gritty. The Cora restaurant downstairs was super convenient and served up a mean breakfast. Staff was OK, I can't say they were very friendly, but they weren't overtly rude either. They sort of scoffed at my AAA rate, but whatever. Overall, this will do if you are interested in seeing the city on a budget and aren't expecting the Ritz, but I'll likely look for a different hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hate It and Will NEVER Be Back.”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler72011
Reviews.Content: After a full day of flying got to my room and was shocked! When the door opened it barely cleared the wall. The room is so small that I had to turn to walk between the bed and the crappy desk and table at the foot of the bed. There was no way for me to control the air conditioning and I went to the desk to ask about it, was told they would send someone up, still waiting. I don't care that it isn't expensive, it's actually more than I paid at the Intercontinental last time I was here, unfortunately that hotel was not available this trip. There is no room to put anything so I've got the desk piled so have to sit on bed to work. I have nothing good to say, well the fitness room looks good will be trying that in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough...”
Reviews.Author: klodya
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a business trip to Montreal, I was disappointed when I first got my voucher saying the booking had been made there. I knew Best Western was nothing too fancy, but this hotel is plain boring and average. The check-in was fast and easy, lady was nice. There is a nice terasse on the roof of the hotel but there are no chairs/tables to chill out there. The room was very clean and tidy, with a nice big flatscreen TV. Bathroom was functional and very clean too. The room smelled like cigarette A LOT, which is a total turn-off for me. And it was so tiny!! No mini-bar/fridge. Only one SUPER SLOW elevator was working out of the 2 ones. Maybe I'm just used to hotels that have more amenities when I book for myself, but I'd think twice before going back there on my own. I was bummed that there was nothing to do at all. What does it the most is its location, right through downtown! I guess if you can get a good deal and don't plan on spend a lot of time in your room, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Small and cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: bvdbobcat
Reviews.Content: We traveled from Quebec City to Montreal via VIA train and picked a hotel near the train station and walked the few blocks to the hotel. The outside was nice, the entrance could have used a ramp as you had to carry your bags down 15 steps. The lobby was nice, but when we got to our room we thought we entered the closet. The door opened looking into the bathroom and a 4 foot wide hallway that went about 8 feet. The queen size bed took up most of the room with about 2 foot around the bed to walk. At the foot of the bed there was a 3 drawer dresser that couldn't open all the way as it would hit the bed. The desk contained a lamp with a place for 3 plugs, but none of the outlets worked. We went to get ice and the ice machine on our floor didn't work. The one nice thing was the 42 inch flat screen TV. If you don't mind being cramped, then the hotel is located in a nice section of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Worth booking again... if windows can be opened”
Reviews.Author: JayyKenny
Reviews.Content: Parking costs way too much per day. Overall, it is a pretty decent hotel in downtown MTL close to Bell Center with nice restaurants and hungout spots. My only issue is getting suffocated due to the windows that you cannot open. They really got to do something about that. Cora Breakfast restaurant is pretty decent and the hotel is quite nice. There is a nice spot/bar on the mainfloor where you can play pool and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RicksonR
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was wonderful, and the staff was incredible specially Alexandra that made our stay even better upon our chek in , really friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. The buffet idea for the Gran Prix was delicious. without doubt I suggest The Best Western Europa

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: jerispeer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2011. Unlike previous review(s), we were quite happy with it. Had a quite large room with 2 COMFORTABLE beds, hardwood floor, flat-screen TV and coffeemaker. Yes, bathroom only had pedestal sink, but also had a large counter space adjacent. Agreed, there is no "view", but you get what you pay for. As far as "paper-thin walls", we did not experience that - heard nothing. Their Cafe Cora is excellent. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during my sight seeing trip to Montreal and it was so so. Hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from Central station which is useful if you're arriving on VIA Rail like myself. It is also just off St.Catherines which is the main street in Montreal. There is plenty to do here with plenty of shops, close to underground city, numerous eateries, bars and strip clubs. Old Montreal is probably a 15-20 minute walk either street level or through the underground city passages. I was able to do all my sight seeing on foot. Now for the hotel, check-in was quick and yes the lifts were slow and unreliable. I opted for the stairs as I was only on the 3rd floor. Might be a little harder if you're negotiating with luggage on higher levels. The complimentary wifi was slow and I found myself making trips to Starbucks or Second Cup coffee to find a better connection. The flatscreen tv was only standard definition but there were many pubs in the area with HD for you to watch live sports if you require. There is absolutely no sound proofing as previously mentioned. You can hear everything from other rooms and the hallways. I'm sure people in the hallway could hear me in the shower/toilet as well. Might be a little unnerving for some? Other than that the room was clean with enough floor space to be comfortable so like I mention in this post title - I am undecided on the overall value of this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but paper-thin walls - bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertAngel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa for two nights. As we were in Montreal for a relaxing sight-seeing weekend, we didn't require anything more than a clean, quiet place to sleep the night. As many other travellers mention, on most counts this is a great hotel. The staff were extremely friendly, and usually helpful (e.g. answered all our questions regarding the city, came to troubleshoot our wireless reception problems etc). Room service was fine, and did not have any trouble coming in late to clean. Our room (single queen) was clean, had many great perks (wireless internet that worked most of the time, complete set of toiletries, nice furniture, coffee maker in room, iron, hairdryer, etc). The location is also great & safe (a slightly sketchy side-street, but only a few meters from the central street of Montreal). The room was a little smaller than other hotels, but very comfortable. Unfortunately, when selecting this hotel, we ignored comments from other travelers regarding the noise level in this hotel; this was a mistake. The walls in the hotel are rice-paper thin; at night we could hear every single sound from adjoining rooms, as if it were happening right next to us , from chairs creaking, and people holding whispered discussions, to laughing companies of undergrads returning from their nighttime revelries at 5am, having a good time in their rooms. Note that, at most times, guests at the hotel were not being unreasonably loud; however, the lack of sound-proofing made their everyday noises a serious impediment to a good night's sleep. Needless to say, we didn't manage to get much sleep. We were also quite dismayed when, after bringing the problem to the staff's attention, they were unable to provide us with earplugs (or offer any other solution, for that matter), and suggested we try a local pharmacy (albeit very politely). Other - very minor- issues we had: The bed was incredibly squeaky (even slight motions would result in loud squeaks); the guest directory in the room was a bit outdated (it stated that the hotel sells stamps, while it does not); the alley close to the hotel smells foul, and twice we saw drunk/homeless people using it as a toilet. In summary, this is a great place if you don't intend to sleep much (e.g. if you are a young adult traveling to Montreal for wild nightlife), or are able to sleep regardless of the noise. I would not, however, recommend it for the average traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice - valet car paking a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Gav1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room was nice. Decent sized room, although only small window. The ebds were comfortable and there was minimal noise from outside, even with a fire station not too far away. I didn't sleep too well the first night as arrived late and the car park attendant was not there. WIth the car park not being owned by the hotel I wasn't satisfied by the comment 'the car will be ok, they won't tow it' from reception. Having read the hotel had valet parking I got a shock when the car park was a bit of land across the road and run seperately to the hotel. Also you could not move the car once on the car park otherwise you will be charged twice! Taking the cases across a road as well is not my idea of fun! The hotel lobby is really nice, the lift for the lobby is really slow though, but the main lifts to the rooms are ok. Our room was supposedly cleaned whilst we were out but the bin was still full and the toiletries were re-stocked so think the cleaner had just made the beds and left her envelope for the tip! I'd look around at other hotels before staying here again should I go to Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rbdick1zippy63
Reviews.Content: We were aware of the parking situation prior to arrival so the $20/day fee was no problem. The lobby had a beautiful fountain in it , and the greeting from the young woman at the front desk was cordial and professional. Upon entering our room I was pleasantly surprised, there were hardwood floors ,modern comfortable beds, a beautifully clean bathroom, and a 42" flat screen TV. The staff was full of great recommenations where to go to eat, the SAQ store location, pharmacie, etc. Chez Cora in the hotel has the best breakfast I've ever had. Stay here and you'll be happy!!

Reviews.Title: “3/30/2011 Car broken into on the paid parking lot....”
Reviews.Author: RMladenov
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms in the hotel booked and paid online. The first unpleasant surprise was that parking was not included, so we had to pay $20 a night extra per car. And the next surprise came in the morning - the car window was broken, and a GPS stolen from the glovebox of the car. The hotel staff said the parking is not owned or operated by them; the parking attendant said there is no one at the lot after 9 PM, and they have no responsibility either. They did not even think they should refund the $20 parking fee... Unless you really have to be exactly there, find a hotel located in a better area!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent European style hotel."”
Reviews.Author: OdieStPaul_MN
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in the Best Western Europa in Montreal. Best Western seems to be purchasing smaller European-type hotels and renovating them. This hotel is exemplary of that program. The hotel is centrally located. The lobby is attractive. The room was recently renovated; renovation in other rooms was underway. Though small, the room had everything I wanedt: comfortable bed, heat/air conditioning with temperature controls; coffee maker, etc. The bathroom, though extremely small, was newly appointed and efficiently arranged. Internet access was free and easy. Television was new and station selection impressive. The staff was very helpful and efficient. I definitely would stay at the Europa again.

Reviews.Title: “dark suffocating rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrMidland
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dark and suffocating. They smell of a mixture of sweat, dirt and shake and vac. One can't even open the windows to air the rooms. The rooms were not clean. I went out and bought wipers to clean the taps, sink etc. The shower was not working properly. The only good thing about this hotel is that it is downtown, hence perfect for business travel. The reception staff are nice and friendly - but this can't make up for the poor quality rooms upstairs. Avoid it if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: sssask
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable location, right in the heart of downtown. Perfect for going to a habs game, perfect for shopping downtown, and perfect for going to nice restaurants! The rooms were very very nice, newly renovated floors and large bathroom. Flat screen tv and extremely comfortable beds. You will not regret this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: clevbr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown of Montreal, near Centre Bell, where the Montreal Canadians play and Eaton Centre, a very nice shopping mall. You have acess to the subway very easy and have lots of stores to shop at Sainte-Catherine Street. The room is ok and you get what you pay, with free wifi internet. Plenty of restaurants to eat nearby and a suggest to have breakfast at Chez Cora, inside the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Good non-smoking downtown Montreal hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: SoPoME
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed in room 510 for 1 night in January 2011. It was a large clean T shaped room at the end of a hallway with 2 double beds with a small window with no view of the city. The bathroom was small but clean and functional. The old CRT TV received 30+ channels including the major US broadcast networks in English. We had no problem with noise from other rooms or the street. The hotel is located downtown on Drummond between St. Catherine and Rene Levesque West. I parked in the Autoparc Stanley garage one street over on Stanley for $14 CDN for 24 hours. If you enter the garage after 6 PM the change is $6 CDN for 12 hours. The unattended open lot across Drummond from the hotel changes $20 per night. You can park at the metered spots on the street for free in the evening. There was also free parking in front of the hotel on Drummond for 15 minutes to check in. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant for about $30 CDN. The food was good and the service was too.

Reviews.Title: “Great room if you get the king bed!”
Reviews.Author: Dusan_Laura
Reviews.Content: As the title states, we thought our room was excellent (king size bed) for the size compared to the queens our friends got. To compare we could fit a party of 14 people in the room without feeling too cramped up. We could barely walk around in the queen bed room. Everything else was fine. No problems with anything. Excellent place to crash after a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “2stars...”
Reviews.Author: anectine
Reviews.Content: Great welcome, staff very friendly and polite, good location, free hi speed wifi working good, nice bathroom, but tacky lobby, no parking you park in public parking close to hotel for 20 bucks, small room, old carpet still smelling of cigarette pre non smoking era, room temperature with no individual control, thin walls

Reviews.Title: “Great location but loud”
Reviews.Author: HLoriC
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean, the location is really central and close to shopping district and McGill main campus. Rooms streetside though are very loud at night when bars get out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality of Hotel service, but highly disorganized guest intake.”
Reviews.Author: augustwed
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding guest block reserved in May for an August wedding. Went got my tour, loved it all, location is the best so signed the contract for my 10 rooms for my out of town wedding guests. Come time when my guests are calling to make their reservations, they were always being told that there are no rooms booked. Specifically gave them the group code#, group name...but front desk doesnt know about it. When I call the group sales guy, he apologizes says everything looks perfect but next day someone else calls me with the same problem. I tried it a couple of times myself calling the front desk trying to reserve, same response. I get transferred to group sales, same apology. What a pain. Anyways, we got to the wedding day. I fully paid my Wedding Singer's room since it is part of my contract, he came, sang and when he was about to check out after the weekend, they say he cant leave without paying. I am on my honeymoon, no where to talk to so he paid. Then imagine the number of calls from my wedding singer, when I come back from my honeymoon, pissed off and paid 490 something dollars he never expected. Thank god for credit cards! All in all, great hotel but bad service. Too many mistakes!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lobby looks different from pictures”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveller123
Reviews.Content: The lobby was low, and lighting was not sufficient. The furniture in lobby looks like got from a YMCA. However, the stuff was friendly. The window of the room we stayed was small. The park is not free, and without guard.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a few extra $'s and stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: BonfireCalgary
Reviews.Content: Wow! I don't know what i said to the front desk clerk to deserve the worst room in the hotel...or at least it felt like the worst room - at the end of a hall by an exit door - noisy all night. The bed was as hard as sleeping on the floor and the view was of a brick wall with an alcove covered in pigeon pooh - hardly any natural light. Elevators were slow and the staff was polite but also slow. It was hit and miss to find a pop machine that worked. Room has a funky smell. Redeeming qualities: free internet and only 1/ 2 block to St. Catherine's Street. I would recommed this hotel if you were on a budget and were only spending time here to take a shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The very bare minimum in everything”
Reviews.Author: marian0286
Reviews.Content: The lobby should have given us a clue when we arrived. No furniture at all except for two chairs at the computers.Only the male clerk at the desk ever smiled. The females were all unhelpful when asked about tours and restaurants, claiming they didn't know if tours were running or restaurants were open as it was Labor Day. When asked if she could call the tour company she did do it, ditto with a restaurant, but not graciously. Our king-bed room was adequate and bright as it faced the street, but our friends queen bed room faced a wall and was cell-like and depressing. The bathtub was very slippery, but there was no mat

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Stevebass
Reviews.Content: First is my chek in great service really nice staff really friendly .. the room that i had was wonderful big and with a jacuzzi even better i had a king size bed i really loved my room the location is even better you have everything close i only had a little bit of probleme with my wireless connection .. but i called and they were very nice and helped me out In my chek out There was this young girl with brown hair spanish girl that was very helpful she called a taxi for me she was really nice i have to say my trip to montreal was even better because of them there was this other guy that was taking the night shift really helpful with directions :) so I have to say really GOOd hotel a perfect location and the staff makes your stip even better in montreal .

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed...!”
Reviews.Author: jgagauth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 2 nights. I was expecting a little bit more from a Best Western...! I stayed in many (sometimes categorized as lower quality tan Best Western) hotel chains (i.e, Super 8, Comfort Inn etc...) and had a much better experience than Best Western Europa. Notes: - The hotel has no dedicated parking. You have to use public parking nearby. As we were staying during a weekend, no problem for available space, but I suspect that during business hours, it would be a challenge to find parking with nearby public parking. - Our room (second floor) had a Queen bed. The room was extremely small. The bathroom was very, very small. The toilet is facing the bathtub (with only 4 inches clearance. Tall person have to sit sideway. TV was LCD and our room had a new A/C Unit. No fridge in the room. We ask for a fridge, but none available. - Wireless Internet is available and free. However, it wasn't working in our room. We called the front desk and were referred to call a 1-800 # just to be told that the "Internet Server" was down and no ETA available. I was surprised to see that the Front Desk staff would not "handle the issue" as this was a "hotel internet problem" but referred their guests to liaise with a support agency...! - The room adjacent to ours, had their alarm clock set (buzzer making loud noise) with no one in the room. We reported it to the Front Desk (in the morning) and were told that someone would go to "turn it off", but at night it was still buzzing (more than 10 hrs later), we had to report it again and it was turned off approx 2 hours later. Needless to say I have seen much better staff response/service with similar issue at other hotel in the past...! - Our mattress had seen much bettter days. We kept rolling in the center of it as the bed was quite old. In conclusion: In my previous stay in Montreal, we stayed at the Omni Mont-Royal (on Sherbrooke Street) and for almost the same price ($20.00 difference per night) we had a much better experience. If you can, avoid the Best Western Europa and try the Omni or any other hotel in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand all the complaints...”
Reviews.Author: Jay260460
Reviews.Content: I stupidly read some of these reviews a few days before we left for a 4 night stay at this hotel. I was really upset because I wanted to have a lovely holiday with my teenage daughter and thought I had made a terrible mistake by booking this hotel. The hotel is small, needs some updating and new ideas perhaps, but the reception staff were always helpful and polite, and we never came across the 'you should speak french' attitude described by some here. The room was by no means small, nor was the bathroom. Both were a good size and above all clean and tidy which is all I wanted in a room where I would just be sleeping anyway. The empty fridge was a huge bonus for keeping drinks and snacks in, much better than loads of alcohol in most hotels which I never use anyway. The hairdryer incidentally, was the best I have ever used in a hotel, as was the tea/coffee maker! The hotel itself is in a perfect position for shopping, just a few seconds walk to the main street and meant we could at any point, pop back there to drop off purchases or just have an afternoon rest or cooldown, as it was very hot while we were there. We loved the Cora restaurant and ate breakfast there each morning. It was a real treat to have so much fresh fruit on offer and beautifully presented no matter what you chose on the menu. All in all we would definitely return without a problem. Thank you BW Europa for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Minor annoyances, overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: quof
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for a concert at the Bell Centre, just a 5 minute walk, and just steps from St. Catherine Street in the opposite direction. The shuttle bus from the airport stops just a block away,and the metro is also a quick walk. I was in the back, so the room was dark as a cave, however, I didn't hear the fire trucks that others complain about. There was no fan in the bathroom, so the shower set off the smoke detector each morning, and a minibar/fridge would have been a great addition to the room. The only breakfast option on-sight was Cora's, which is overpriced for pretty but tasteless food, but I guess some people like it.

Reviews.Title: “Next door to a fire station”
Reviews.Author: alottapickles
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night, thankfully not more as room was extremely small. Location is right in middle of Drummond St. so close to bus stops, metro stations, shops and restaurants however it's also right next door to the fire station. Heard the truck/sirens pull out twice while we were there so wouldn't recommend unless you can sleep like the dead. Worst BW i've ever stayed at as hotel itself is old and outdated, and again room is like a tin can. Any guy staying here will find the location of the toliet annoying as their knees will definitely be mashed up against the shower/tub while sitting down. Only saving grace is Chez Cora that's open for just breakfast and lunch, extremely filling and lots of fresh fruits- A MUST if looking for good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor hotel.”
Reviews.Author: koalatm
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was the only one of the two downtown Montreal best westerns which would accept gift cards during Grand Prix weekend. The location is excellent. Half a block from St. Catherine with all of the amazing restaurants and shops. Parking is questionable. There are a few outdoor lots right by the hotel, each of which is not actually run by the hotel. We parked where we were told, blocking in several vehicles, which we thougt was strange but decided they must have a reason. If I was not driving a rental car I would not have felt comfortable parking here. The room was tiny. Barely enough space to accommodate a queen size bed, small desk and a small dresser which had a 40~" tv. The tv was the only nice thing in the room, even though the picture quality was very bad. The bed was a substandard basic coil bed with very little padding and caused a lot of pain for both of us (mid-20's, in good shape I like to think). The pillows were old, lumpy polyester filled, and the "duvet" was also poly filled and slept way too hot. The hotel has no pool, no gym, no room service and the drink machine only accepts USD, which is very strange. The only thing that made this hotel bearable was copius amounts of alcohol consumed over the Grand Prix weekend. On one other note, the attached restaurant (Chez Cora) was fantastic. Excellent breakfast, very good value for money and highly recommended. When we visit Montreal again we will not consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU LOVE BAD ATTITUDE, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: LindsToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the weekend. Alexandre at the front desk was an evil monster. I had 2 rooms booked, I pre checked the second room in so my friend wouldn't have problems when he arrived at the hotel. The girl Nellie was so nice, friendly and helpful. She really was great. Alexandre on the front desk was full of attitude, he was downright rude. He over authorized my credit card and took all my available funds on it. I had parked using my Visa so I couldn't get it out of the car without my Visa but since my Visa was declined it wouldn't let me exit. I paid 49.99$ a day for a car that I didn't even have access to for three days. When I kindly asked the hotel to call Visa he refused to do so. I spent more of my weekend on hold with Visa & Best Western then I did having a good time. The hotel room was clean. When we arrived at the hotel I was told I couldn't have 2 beds like I had booked with the manager and my son, my husband and I had to share a tiny room with a cot and a bed. On the third day Nellie moved us to a room with two beds. The location was great but I'd rather stay elsewhere so I don't have to deal with Alexandre on the front desk. I work in a hotel and if I treated someone like how he treated me I would be fired. It was really nice when he said in french to someone (I speak french) that he couldn't help me because I refused to leave the desk!! The hotel did end up giving me a discount of 47$ but when I look at it, I paid 169.47$ for a vehicle I couldn't even use. So 169.47$ minus 47.00$ = 122.47. I paid $122.47 for nothing! I should have taken the bus. It's a shame they have someone like that working at their hotel because if it wasn't for him I would have had the best time ever. I can just imagine how my phone bill will be spending so much time with Visa and Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, you will have a better stay at a truck stop.”
Reviews.Author: xxchalice
Reviews.Content: You know you are in trouble when the person who checks you at the door has an immediate attitude and avoided even talking to us for 5 minutes when me and my spouse were the only people in the room. We were actually happy to have arrived at the hotel and were immediately greeted by a staff member who was more interested in talking on his cell phone than checking us in. This hotel was in dis-repair and the staff was awful. The floor boards were missing (yes actually missing), the carpets were tattered, the ice machines on two different floors did not work and there was ongoing work being done (i.e. , new room development, painting, etc...). When I made mention of this to my booking agent they called the hotel and spoke with the manager "Alex" who said that in fact none of this was going on and that nothing could be done. He flat out lied to the agent and continued to lie directly to them. We had an employee from the hotel painting the door to our room while we were there and he said it never happened. Do people just randomly paint hotel doors in Montreal? I left this hotel early to find better accommodations and they would not even partially refund me. Best Westerns are often a shot in the dark considering they are individually managed, but this one took it to another level. Also, the travel site that booked my stay has this hotel rated as a 2 Â½ star hotel, itâ€™s a 1 star at best. There are roadside truck stops that are better accommodations and staffed with better people.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but most affordable close to Bell Centre”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-and-Ross_B
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to the Bell Centre and was the cheapest in the area. No problems checking in, we had booked through expedia last minute and paid $140. Our room on the 2nd floor was very very small by Quebec/Canada standards. The bathroom was especially small, I am only 5 feet, 2 inches tall and I could not comfortably sit on the toilet. My husband actually had to use the public bathrooms in the lobby since his legs were too long to fit in the space between the toilet and bathtub. The bathroom also had no fan, and the one window in the room did not open, and there was no A/C or thermostat to adjust temp in the room. The room was clean. You could hear a lot of noise from outside, I am not sure if it is normally that loud or if the crowds outside were just excited after the hockey game. The location of this hotel is excellent, close to a lot of restaurants and bars, as well as great shopping areas. I would not recommend this hotel for families, as it was noisy and small, but it is fine if you just want a place to sleep in a good location. Also, no parking provided by hotel, but there is a public parking lot across the street - approx $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel parking - at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: Family41
Reviews.Content: Best Western Europa does not have underground parking, they suggest patrons park across the street in a Parking Lot owned by another management. My van plus another SUV both were vandalized in this parking lot overnight. Smashed in windows. Out of town plates are a huge target says police. Not a great way to end a vacation. Hotel was okay, close to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Train_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I took a trip to Montreal back in October and stayed for two nights at this downtown Best-Western. I took the train into Montreal and the hotel was only a few blocks from the Via Rail Train Station. I am a loyal Best Western Customer but this hotel did not seem like any other Best Western I have stayed in while visiting other cities. Check in was easy and the staff were friendly and knew were all the good resturants and bars were and provided some suggestions on where to shop. The lobby is attractive with an Itilian feel with a fountian and europiean decorations. This hotel is however old and worn. The elevators are crampted, the hallways are narrow and the rooms are very small with limited space to move around and store your luggage. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I was provided with everything I needed such as the standard soap, shampoo and clean towels. I wouldn't stay here expecting a view because the windows are small and some of the rooms look out onto an alley way or into another building. I would only reconmend this hotel for the younger crowd who enjoyes the night life and just need a place to sleep and those who are traveling on a budget. There are no facilites at this hotel. If you have high expectations or plan on spending alot of time in your room, I would reconmend that you stay somewhere else. Overall my stay was fine but on my next trip to Montreal I will book my stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks a little tired, but we were pleased overall”
Reviews.Author: angela1440
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Best Western Europa Montreal for one night this wknd. I had a voucher for a free night at a Best Western. Room 304 and the hallways look a little tired, but we were pleased overall with the room. We went to shop and go to a spa for the weekend and spent little time on the room. It seemed clean, was pretty quiet at the end of the hallway. It had a heated bathroom. It is only a half block from the main shopping area on Ste-Catherine St. And we were able to walk to the hotel from the VIA train station, only 5 or 6 blocks. There is no view, just an alley below the window. The Coraâ€™s restaurant is handy to have in the lobby for a nice breakfast or lunch. Front desk staff was also very polite and professional, and recommended a great restaurant for dinner. They also let us check in 3 hrs before check-in. I will definitely stay there again for an easy weekend getaway from Ottawa.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 2.5 star hotel, in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked via PL for 40$. Location, location, location. If you want to stay in the downtown core, this is it. Mind you, this is a BW, but I find that it has all the basic things you need: free phone and internet, good beds... only downpoint...the 20$ outside parking lots (no hotel parking). Oh well. The room was very large, very well equiped (even though it was not upscale)...but remember, this is not a 4 star, so most of the amenities are included. I got lucky for breakfast, there was a craft show in the lobby, and they were giving good pastries. The gym is rather basic, situated on last floor, with the spa. Very zen place to work out (although i'm not sure the spa clients would appreciate the rumblings of the machines). Close to the subways, Ste-Catherine...a great deal if you get it cheap on PL.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jswatts72
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel if you are planning on staying in Montreal. Very close to more shopping than Mag Mile in Chicago. A couple of blocks from metro, Bell Centre and night clubs. There is a resturant Cora in the hotel but sometimes I don't want to spend $30 for breakfast. The hotel advertises a free breakfast but they discontinued it and haven't bothered to update the hotel. There is a spa on the top level I had a massage and expected a little more for the money. But I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even waist your money”
Reviews.Author: mommydToronto
Reviews.Content: ya the rooms are small I went with my husband and son the beds were comfortable but the service ahhh no ... you know what don't even waist your time at the time of check in we requested a queen size bed they didn't have it available we made the reservation a few days ago, so they gave us another room at no extra charge, but they wanted a $20 deposit incase you rent a movie... anyway yes the bathroom is small and they had running hot water, but when it was time to check out the receptionist said ya you get your $20.00 back they put it back in your account so my husband called the credit card company to see if they put back the money ... the receptionist lied so my husband went back and had to complain the receptionist gave us the run-around so on top of that they gave us the money back in cash... and the parking lot was across the street from the hotel ... so if i were you don't bother going to this hotel i hope you make the smart decision

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Habscouple
Reviews.Content: Best Western Europa is located in the heart of downtown Montreal, close to lots of shopping, restaurants and of course the Bell Centre. If you are planning to get out and keep busy seeing the sights, this hotel is great. If you want a large luxurious room to spend a bunch of time in, you might want to choose another hotel. >Rooms are very, very small. Not only the actual room but the bathroom is tiny as well. Relatively clean, although while we were getting ready to check out we found an old black banana peel. Elevators are also small. No issue with noise, we found the rooms to be quiet. >Staff is polite, helpful when asked. >Restaurant in lobby, Chez Cora serves breakfast and was good, but long lineups on weekends. As noted above, lots of restaurants within walking distance to choose from as well. For us, the price was reasonable and the location was superb. We don't spend a whole lot of time in the room on trips, so we would consider staying here again next time we visit. Metro station is also close by, so getting elsewhere in the city (Old Montreal, ect.) is very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, tinier washrooms, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: k5shah
Reviews.Content: I am not sure why this hotel has good reviews. Small smelly rooms. Tinier washroom. Horrible service. We checked into the hotel because I have stayed at other Best Western hotels and this is nothing like them. Compared to this Best Western, the other Best Western hotels were luxury hotels!! I am writing this review from the hotel room. Our room was so small only one of us could move in the little space between our bed and the TV. The washroom was so tiny that you would have to sit on the edge of the pot so that your knees don't bang against the wall. The exhaust in the washroom gave both of us a terrible headache. The washroom did not have sufficient toiletries for 2 people so I called the front desk. It took me more than 1 hour to have 1 extra towel, soap and shampoo sent up to the room. Basically - a very disappointing experience. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: ohlavache
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Ups: Clean, comfortable hotel. Good location, and close to both the green and orange subway lines. Great value! Downs: The location is convenient but we ended up trekking to other neighborhoods most of the time. The service is disappointing - staff was either unfriendly or inexperienced. Our single King room was right by the elevator and I heard all the people walking by. Maid service came at an alarming 830AM, waking us up way too early. Even with all the downsides, the hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Run Down Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Europa hotel on Drummond Street July 21-24, 2009. The hotel was in a great location right in the centre of everything. It was within walking distance to the Metro station, shopping and tourist attractions. The staff at the hotel went to great lengths to assist us in whatever we needed. My problem was with the room. We stayed in 412 and let me tell you, this room was very basic. The carpet is worn out and looks dirty. The air conditioner was really loud and every time the compresser went on and off it banged. This went on through the entire night. The bathroom has to win an award for the worst layout I have ever seen. The toilet is so close to the door, that when you are sitting, your knees are actually touching the bathroom door. The hotel restaurant has closed and a Cora's has opened up next door with a very limited menu. We went up to have a look at the spa area which opened up to replace the roof top pool. The floor were all cracking and there were actually holes in the walls. In my opinion this hotel is in serious need for some rennovations. The front lobby looks great but the rest of the hotel needs some work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small "Comfort Level" rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: slimster99
Reviews.Content: Room was small but in great shape, price was great, awesome location, Cora restaurant in hotel only serves breakfast food. Would stay again for one overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller216
Reviews.Content: Came to Montreal for the weekend to visit some friends and booked into the Best Western Europa last minute. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment I arrived and the hotel has a nice up scale feel. The room was incredibly small and I could not imagine sharing it with another person but it was very clean and the bed was comfortable - I really didn't need any more than that. Plus it included free wireless internet which really came in handy. The restaurant in the lobby served a great breakfast but it's the location that makes this hotel a real winner. Just steps from St. Catherine Street, it is right in the middle of the shopping district during the day and the club district for nightly entertainment. There are fantastic restaurants of all kinds every where and many attractions and museums all with in walking distance. As well Old Montreal is only about a 15-20 min walk away.
